Yes, there have been many success stories of schools implementing strategies to address bullying based on gender identity. Here are a few examples:

1. The Los Angeles Unified School District has implemented a policy that allows students to use the restroom and locker room that corresponds with their gender identity. The policy also provides guidelines for how to address and prevent gender-based harassment.

2. In Connecticut, a high school created a gender-neutral restroom to be more inclusive of all students. The restroom was designed with input from students and provides a safe space that is respectful of students' gender identities.

3. The Seattle Public School system has created a transgender students and staff policy that provides guidance on a range of issues, including gender-specific facilities, confidentiality, and respectful language. The policy also includes training for staff on how to address issues related to gender identity with sensitivity and respect.

By implementing policies and practices that support transgender and gender non-conforming individuals, schools can create more inclusive and equitable learning environments for all students. These examples demonstrate the positive impact of such strategies and the importance of continuing to work towards full inclusion for all students.
